Begini Suasana Kericuhan di Kongres Luar Biasa PSSI
02 Nov 2019, 06:56 by Irsyan Hasyim (Kontributor), Rina Widiastuti
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Kekisruhan sempat mewarnai jalan Kongres Luar Biasa PSSI atau KLB PSSI di Hotel Shangri-La, Sabtu 2 November 2019. Enam orang calon ketua PSSI sempat melakukan interupsi yang warnai aksi saling dorong dengan pihak keamanan.
Kongres yang berlangsung tertutup itu telah menetapkan Mochamad Iriawan atau Iwan Bule sebagai Ketua Umum PSSI periode 2019-2023. Iwan mendapatkan 82 suara dari 86 suara.
Tempo menerima dua video yang memperlihatkan kericuhan yang terjadi di dalam lokasi kongres. Dalam video berdurasi 1 menit 56 detik mengambarkan suasana kekisruhan yang terjadi dalam Kongres Luar Biasa PSSI, terlihat enam calon ketua umum yakni Vijaya Fitriyasa, Fary Djemi Francis, Yesayas Oktavianus, Sarman, Aven S Hinelo, dan Benny Erwin berdiri melakukan interupsi ke pimpinan sidang. Terdengar suara pimpinan sidang yakni Sekjen PSSI Ratu Tisha yang meminta para kandidat untuk tenang.
"Jika para kandidat tidak dapat duduk maka dipersilakan meninggalkan ruangan," kata Tisha yang dikutip dari video yanh diterima Tempo. Tisha juga meminta pihak keamanan untuk menenangkan situasi.
Dalam video kedua yang diterima Tempo berdurasi 1 menit 21 detik, terlihat satu calon ketua umum PSSI, Sarman didorong keluar ruangan pihak keamanan. "Keluar," kata pihak keamanan.
Sebelumnya, calon Ketua Umum PSSI, Benhard Limbong mengundurkan diri sejam menjelang Pembukaan Kongres Luar Biasa. "Saya tidak ikut karena tidak bisa full time di PSSI," kata dia menjelasakan alasannya mudur menjelang pemilihan di Hotel Shangrila, Jakarta, Sabtu, 2 November 2019.
Kongres ini diikuti 86 voter dari berbagai anggota PSSI, terdiri dari 34 Asosiasi Provinsi (Asprov), 18 klub Liga 1, 16 klub Liga 2, 16 klub Liga 3, 1 Asosiasi Futsal (FFI) dan 1 Asosiasi Sepak Bola Wanita.
Pada KLB ini perwakilan FIFA dan AFC juga turut hadir. Kehadiran delegasi FIFA dan AFC untuk memantau dan mengawasi langsung jalannya KLB dengan agenda pemilihan ketua umum, wakil ketua umum dan anggota komite eksekutif PSSI.
Dua delegasi FIFA yang hadir, yakni Head of Member Association Governance Service, Luca Nicola dan Development Manager Southeast and East Asia, Lavin Vignesh.
Sementara dari AFC ada tiga delegasi yakni Head of South Asia Unit AFC Member Association and Regional Associations Departemen, Purushottam Kattel, Manager of Asean Unit AFC Member Association and Regional Associations Departement, Nhodkeo Phawadee dan Secretary of AFC Member Association and Regional Associations Departement, Varankumar Sagaran.

This is the atmosphere of unrest in the Extraordinary Congress of PSSI
02 Nov 2019, 06:56 by Irsyan Hasyim (Contributor), Rina Widiastuti
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - The chaos colored the street of the Extraordinary Congress of PSSI or KLSI PSB at the Shangri-La Hotel, Saturday, November 2, 2019. Six candidates for the PSSI chairman had interrupted the color of the mutual push with the security forces.
The closed congress had appointed Mochamad Iriawan or Iwan Bule as General Chair of PSSI 2019-2023. Iwan got 82 votes out of 86 votes.
Tempo received two videos showing the upheaval that took place inside the location of the congress. In a 1 minute 56 second video describing the chaos that occurred in the Extraordinary Congress of PSSI, it was seen six general chairmen candidates namely Vijaya Fitriyasa, Fary Djemi Francis, Yesayas Oktavianus, Sarman, Aven S Hinelo, and Benny Erwin stood interrupting the leadership of the session. The leader of the session heard the Secretary General of PSSI Ratu Tisha who asked the candidates to calm down.
"If the candidates cannot sit, then they are invited to leave the room," Tisha was quoted as saying in a video Tempo received. Tisha also called on security to calm the situation.
In the second video received by Tempo for 1 minute and 21 seconds, one candidate for PSSI chairman, Sarman, was pushed out of the security office. "Get out," the security said.
Earlier, PSSI General Chairperson Benhard Limbong resigned an hour ahead of the Opening of the Extraordinary Congress. "I did not participate because I could not be full time at PSSI," he said, explaining the reason for being late before the election at the Shangrila Hotel, Jakarta, Saturday, November 2, 2019.
The congress was attended by 86 voters from various PSSI members, consisting of 34 Provincial Associations (Asprov), 18 League 1 clubs, 16 League 2 clubs, 16 League 3 clubs, 1 Futsal Association (FFI) and 1 Women's Football Association.
At this outbreak, FIFA and AFC representatives were also present. The presence of FIFA and AFC delegations to directly monitor and supervise the running of the outbreak with the agenda of electing the chairman, deputy chairman and members of the PSSI executive committee.
Two FIFA delegations were present, namely the Head of Member of the Governance Service Association, Luca Nicola and Southeast and East Asia Development Manager, Lavin Vignesh.
While from the AFC there were three delegates namely the Head of South Asia Unit AFC Member Association and Regional Associations Department, Purushottam Kattel, Manager of Asean Unit AFC Member Association and Regional Associations Department, Nhodkeo Phawadee and Secretary of AFC Member Association and Regional Associations Department, Varankumar Sagaran .
